column5: Length is higher end of standard, but that girth is colossal.  An exceptional catch for your buddy Mike.

A very good friend of mine in Thunder Bay sent me these photos a couple of days ago. I'm just in total awe of this fish myself and thought it was worth sharing.  A hair over 25" long, incredibly thick and fat, and 8.1lb's on the digital scale.  The photos aren't the best, he was fishing alone as he usually does, but nevertheless very impressive.  What gets me, he told me he had an even larger fish rush in and swipe at his lure a couple of days later.  What's killing me is I don't have time to get up there and fish with him. It's torture LOL!
Holy crap, I think it's a relative of the one my oldman got!!!! LOL!    So thick and wide, just insane!
That is one beauty!!! That one didnt miss a meal from the looks of it LOL
That's just silly.
awesome fish congrats to your friend

Awesome fish Mike. For anybody that does their homework up here, they'd know that this is a big fish year. Absolutely everyone is catching hogs this year. As for when the next hog year is, I'm not telling. Congrats to your Bud!
ELEPHANT TROUT!!! Seeing that just makes me laugh. A 15" brookie is "big" to me. haha. Nice catch for your buddy!
i think when he cleaned t he might get a feed of smelt as well nice football,  congrats to your buddy
OMG
Wow that's a hog . A beautiful one at that.
Oh my stupid. That is gross. nice fish for sure!
That thing is a tank , congrats to your bud !
Joe material.  BOINK!!
classic squaretail
So fat
That fish looks almost unhealthily fat.  Any chance there is something wrong with it that made it look so bloated and fat?
It's not bloated.... And it's defintely not unhealthy, lol.
Although, reportedly it did complain about feeling bloated at the time.
Very very nice.  Thanks for posting Mike.
Fat speck!  Wow!  I wonder if your buddy's happy about you posting his photos LOL.
that's simply awesome.
Found this shot from a few years back. Pretty much a twin. No weight taken.
Beauty fish, Mike...  Wow!!
It's amazing to think that the record was still much, much larger than that gigantic fish.
Nice fish! Thanks for sharing Mike. Funny, we are usually envious of you when we see your pictures; always wishing we could visit your fishing locations.
